newsitem.title: GERMANY: Merck stocks strongly ahead in pre-bourse trade.
newsitem.headline: Merck stocks strongly ahead in pre-bourse trade.

text.p: Shares in German drugs and chemical group Merck KGaA were strongly ahead in pre-bourse trade on Tuesday, after reporting an 11.3 percent rise in 1996 group sales and forecasting strong profit growth for the year.
Merck shares were up two marks, or 3.45 percent, at 60.05 marks in pre-bourse trade on the IBIS DAX index. The overall market was up 0.25 percent at 3,006.77 points.

Merck said in a mandatory statement earlier on that 1996 sales climbed to 6.98 billion marks from 6.3 billion marks in 1995, of which pharmaceutical sales were the strongest, up 16 percent to 3.9 billion marks.
The group said it expected to post "another significant rise in profits" during the period, without being more specific. Dealers said the market reaction to the figures was extremely positive.
